loss.description: Specifies the loss function. ‘l1’ is the epsilon-insensitive loss (standard SVR) while ‘l2’ is the squared epsilon-insensitive loss.

dual.description: Select the algorithm to either solve the dual or primal optimization problem. Prefer dual=False when n_samples > n_features.

C.description: Penalty parameter C of the error term. The penalty is a squared l2 penalty. The bigger this parameter, the less regularization is used.

epsilon.description: Epsilon parameter in the epsilon-insensitive loss function. Note that the value of this parameter depends on the scale of the target variable y. If unsure, set epsilon=0.
